intro: Morisonia filipes, commonly known as the slender morisonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
